page.title: 19Pollution in Fremington Area
page.content: Fremington is on the estuary of the Taw and Torridge rivers. All the people want a cleansing plant for the sewage. There is also an abbatoir on the quay and lots of blood and guts pour out of pipes into the water. Last summer and the summer before when it was very hot lots of seabirds died of a virus called Botulism. Silage effluent comes from farms into the estuary and kills the fish. We don't like to swim in the sea because of all the muck in it. On 'Watchdog' they said 'the coast around here is so dirty that it's just like bathing in six cups of sewage'. I think the whole area around here is messy and needing a good clean up.
